says.websiteContent:
Whether because of a vacation or a move, we are often called upon to say goodbye. Here are some of the most effective ways: * “Tell my wife I told you to tell my wife that … goodbye.”
* “I always wanted to kiss you but only because I hated you.”
* “Arrivederci." (millionaires only)
* “Stench ya later.”
* “I’m truly better for being involved with all of you. Thank you, and I want only the best things for you. You are great. Here are a bunch of dogs spelling out ‘Goddbye’ (they tried their hardest).”

deals.title: $23 to See “Hedwig and the Angry Inch” at The Boxcar Theatre through June 15 (Up to $45 Value)
deals.highlightsHtml: Hit rock musical weaves the poignant tale of a misunderstood musician in inventive production exploring many angles with cast of eight
deals.announcementTitle: Up to 49% Off “Hedwig and the Angry Inch”
deals.pitchHtml:
The Deal

  • $23 for admission for one to Hedwig and the Angry Inch (up to a $45 value, including order fee)
  • When: any show of your choice through June 15. Performances run Thursday–Saturday at 8 p.m.
  • Where: Boxcar Theatre
  • Seating: best available at the time of redemption
  • Door time: 30 minutes before showtime
  • Ticket values include all fees.
  • Click here to view the seating chart.

Hedwig and the Angry Inch

Since premiering off Broadway in 1998, Hedwig and the Angry Inch has received both an Obie Award and a cult status to rival The Rocky Horror Show. Hedwig––an East German ex-patriot and victim of a botched sex-change operation––tours with her band in the wake of her more successful former boyfriend, rock star Tommy Gnosis. Throughout the show, she shares the tale of her unusual life with an air that is both heartbreaking and charmingly self-deprecating. A cast of eight actors steps into and out of the role and wig of the titular Hedwig, an angle Buck Wolf of Weird News says “works beautifully…one Hedwig takes over seamlessly from another…it feels as if the show was meant to be done this way.” A glam-rock soundtrack backed by a full live band anchors the tale, challenging the audience to tear down Hedwig like the Berlin Wall in “Tear Me Down” before slowing into the surreal rock ballad “Origin of Love,” and finishing with "Midnight Radio."

deals.highlightsHtml: One of baseball’s best teams so far, the defending world champion Giants stride into AT&T Park to take on the Padres, D-backs, and Phillies
deals.announcementTitle: San Francisco Giants – Up to 33% Off Game
deals.pitchHtml:
Playing baseball takes coordination, upper-body strength, and the courage to run counterclockwise even though that direction is normally only for the immoral and weak-hearted. See strong-willed Americans with this GrouponLive deal.

The Deal

  • One ticket to a San Francisco Giants game
  • Where: AT&T Park
  • Door time: 90 minutes before first pitch
  • Click here to view the seating chart.

Game and Seating Options

  • $60 for Lower Box seating against the San Diego Padres on April 19, 20, or 21 (up to an $88 value)
  • $8 for View Reserve Outfield seating against the Arizona Diamondbacks on Monday, April 22 (a $12 value)
  • $28 for Lower Box seating against the Diamondbacks on April 22, 23, or 24 (up to a $40 value)
  • $10 for View Reserve Outfield seating against the Philadelphia Phillies on Monday, May 6 (a $13 value)

The first pitch is at 7:15 p.m. on April 19, 22, and 23 and May 6; at 6:05 p.m. on April 20; at 1:05 p.m. on April 21; and at 12:45 p.m. on April 24.

When you click "Buy," you'll be redirected to sfgiants.com to complete your transaction. This offer applies toward the face value of tickets, but you'll still need to pay all giants.com fees and taxes in full.

Major League Baseball trademarks and copyrights are used with permission of MLB Advanced Media, L.P. All rights reserved.

The Scouting Report

The winners of two of the last three World Series, the Giants marched into the 2013 season with high expectations; thus far, they haven’t disappointed. Through 14 games, the team has compiled a 9–5 record, highlighted by a three-game sweep over the NL West-leading Rockies. A potent lineup has played a major role in the defending world champions’ early success, as the Giants offense has already plated 69 runs—tied for sixth best in all of baseball.

San Francisco Giants

A 9-foot statue of Willie Mays looms over fans at the entrance to AT&T Park, the home of the San Francisco Giants since 2000. Along with the team's many other Hall of Fame inductees, Mays is part of a team heritage that spans more than a century and has garnered 21 National League pennants, six World Series championships, and the most overall victories by a franchise in baseball history. Up to 41,503 fans cheer on the Giants as they swing for the tides, splashing home runs into the waters of McCovey Cove.

says.emailContentHtml: I’m sick and tired of waking up not wearing sunglasses.
says.title: The Groupon Guide to: Picking Teams
says.websiteContent:
Since no one person can even come close to making a difference in this world, teaming up is the only way to get things done. If you’re lucky enough to be the one choosing the lineup, here are some first picks to ensure success, whatever your team: **Bowling:** Person with heaviest and/or shiniest ball
**Kickball:** Whichever child scored highest on the kicking portion of the Presidential Fitness Test
**Improv:** In comedy, loudest equals funniest, so either an umpire or a dog protecting a family
**Marketing:** Someone with big ideas, like a car with really wide wheels, or sunglasses you can wear to bed
**A cappella:** You don’t need anyone else. That voice of yours sounds like it was filtered through an angel.

deals.highlightsHtml: Pizzas with thick cloaks of sauce made from California-grown tomatoes, plus local ice-cream sandwiches
deals.announcementTitle: Papa John's Pizza – Up to 52% Off Pizza, Soda, and IT'S-IT Ice Cream
deals.pitchHtml:
Like the sun, a pizza is round, supports life, and will eventually be destroyed by hungry astronauts. Grab a life-giving slice with this Groupon.

$14 for a Pizza Package (Up to $29.47 Total Value)

  • One large specialty pizza or a create-your-own pizza with up to five toppings (up to a $22.49 value)
  • One three-pack of IT'S-IT ice cream (a $3.99 value)
  • One 2-liter soda (a $2.99 value)

This Groupon is valid at seven locations. Customers who spend an additional $15 are eligible for delivery.

Thirteen specialty-pizza options include John's Favorite, which flaunts a cloak of pepperoni and sausage, and the piping-hot hawaiian barbecue-chicken pizza arrives festooned with golden medallions of pineapple and crisp bacon. The tuscan six-cheese is a bubbling golden circlet draped in italian cheeses like a hibernating Julius Caesar, and the chicken-cordon-bleu pie adapts the French-inspired dish into a crisp, portable pizza format.

Patrons can opt to abstractly adorn a dough disk with a favorite quintet of toppings selected from a palette that includes artichoke hearts, anchovies, and Spanish-grown olives. Diners offset savory pizza slices with a three-pack of IT'S-IT ice-cream sandwiches, a San Francisco original that sandwiches various flavors of IT'S-IT ice cream between dark-chocolate-dipped oatmeal cookies.

says.emailContentHtml: What are some simple rhymes to help you moderate your drinking? Find out in today’s Groupon Guide.
says.title: The Groupon Guide to: Drinking Rhymes
says.websiteContent:
Everybody knows that rhymes such as “Liquor before beer, you’re in the clear; beer before liquor, never sicker” keep drinkers from getting sick. What are some of the most popular? * Brandy before rum, enjoy feeling numb. Rum before brandy, not feeling too dandy.
* Good beer before bad, what a delightful cad. Bad beer before good, you are the opposite of Robin Hood (a jerk).
* Shots before beer, to sickness the path is clear. Beer before shots, I’ve got the hots (for you).
* Beer before entire bottle of wine, you’re doing fine. Entire bottle of wine before beer, Groupon does not, under any circumstances, promote drinking to excess.

Following a nearly 75-year-old tradition, Red & White Fleet embarks on its California Sunset Cruise. The tour departs from Fisherman’s Warf’s Pier 43 1/2 for a scenic jaunt with picturesque sunset views that passes under the infamous Golden Gate bridge and around Alcatraz Island, and passengers enjoy appetizers from the buffet such as sandwiches, salads, and fruit. Live musicians set the sonic background during the two-hour tour, and drinks from a full bar are available for purchase onboard. Children aged 4 and younger are admitted for free.

says.emailContentHtml: What are those dogs trying to spell out? Find out in today's Groupon Guide.
says.title: The Groupon Guide to: Saying Goodbye
says.websiteContent:
Whether because of a vacation or a move, we are often called upon to say goodbye. Here are some of the most effective ways: * “Tell my wife I told you to tell my wife that … goodbye.”
* “I always wanted to kiss you but only because I hated you.”
* “Arrivederci." (millionaires only)
* “Stench ya later.”
* “I’m truly better for being involved with all of you. Thank you, and I want only the best things for you. You are great. Here are a bunch of dogs spelling out ‘Goddbye’ (they tried their hardest).”

deals.highlightsHtml: Area native leads groups on excursions to tastings and private tours at local creameries, oyster farms, or wineries and creameries
deals.announcementTitle: Up to 51% Off Cheese, Oyster, or Wine Tours
deals.pitchHtml:
Studying wine grapes in their natural habitat is much more enjoyable than exploring the dank, melancholy caverns of root beer's namesake. Stroll through bliss with this Groupon.

Choose from Six Options

  • $76 for a Cheese Lover's tour for one (a $152 value)
  • $149 for a Cheese Lover's tour for two (a $304 value)
  • $76 for an Oyster Lover's tour for one (a $152 value)
  • $149 for an Oyster Lover's tour for two (a $304 value)
  • $76 for a Wine and Cheese tour for one (a $152 value)
  • $149 for a Wine and Cheese tour for two (a $304 value)

On the Cheese Lover’s tour, Elizabeth guides participants to four local creameries, where they sample more than 30 house-made artisan cheeses, meet the cheese-makers, and tour each of the facilities. The Oyster Lover's tour leads groups to three local oyster farms, where they taste oysters and join in behind-the-scenes farm tours. At the tour’s end, they head to Saltwater Oyster Depot to sample baked oysters and wine.

On the Wine and Cheese tour, Elizabeth expounds on West Marin’s history as she leads groups to tastings of 20 artisan cheeses at three creameries. The tour also visits two area wineries, where guests taste six wines and embark on a private tour of areas normally closed to the public.

Each guided tour includes round-trip transportation, a printed tour guide, non-alcoholic beverages, a West Marin Food & Farm Tours tote bag and magnet for each person, and an outdoor picnic featuring local bread, cheese, preserves, and meat. Guests on the Cheese Lover's and Wine and Cheese tours meet in Point Reyes Station, and guests on the Oyster Lover's tour meet in Inverness.

says.emailContentHtml: How can you tell if someone you love is a robot? Find out in today's Groupon Guide.
says.title: The Groupon Guide to: Robot Lingo
says.websiteContent:
Robots are all among us, blending in perfectly—unless you know to listen for the telltale robot lingo they use to secretly communicate with each other. Keep your natural, fleshy ears peeled for these robo-slang giveaways: * **Softies:** _Humans_
* **Franks:** _In reference to skinless hot dogs (slang for humans)_
* **LCMs:** _Lucky Charms marshmallows (slang for baby humans)_
* **Sparkin':** _Popular robot style of kissing_
* **Bolt Cutters:** _Traitorous robots that hunt down escaped robots for their human scientist masters_
* **Knife Hands:** _Not slang_
* **Biofuel:** _Every part of a human except for the bones_
* **Delicious Pizza Pies:** _Depending on the context, either pizza or humans_

says.emailContentHtml: What unexpected treasures can you find at the dump? Find out in today's Groupon Guide.
says.title: The Groupon Guide to: One Man’s Trash
says.websiteContent:
So many people just throw out their “garbage” without stopping to think that it might be of value to someone else. Luckily, it all goes to the same place—the dump. Search around a little and you’ll find that this wonderful place is filled with all kinds of unexpected treasures: * Shredded tires
* Hats with the tops ripped off
* Dirty old baby dolls
* Dirty old fish bones
* Car seats with big bites taken out of them
* Shattered, discolored bathtubs
* Records, both musical and medical
* 2-liter bottles with different liquids inside them than what they started with
* Whoa, something hot!
* Boxes and boxes of broken glass

says.emailContentHtml: What are the ways modern kids rebel against their parents? Find out in today's Groupon Guide.
says.title: The Groupon Guide to: Teenage Rebellion
says.websiteContent:
It's an important phase in every teenager's development to differentiate himself from his parents in the form of safe, experimental rebellion. Use this chart to gauge how to best rebel against your own parents' views and wishes: * **If your parents forbid you from hanging out with the cool kids:** Rub it in their faces when the absence of your positive influence leads them to drag race off all the cliffs in town.
* **If your parents listen to old-timey big-band jazz:** Listen to ear-splitting heavy-metal records.
* **If your parents listen to ear-splitting heavy-metal records:** Listen to talk radio that makes a mockery of their deeply held political beliefs.
* **If your parents ask you to wash the dog:** Do it without hesitation; don't make the dog a pawn in your childish game.
* **If your parents ground you for shoplifting candy:** Sneak out of the house and shoplift so much candy that you'll have to go to jail, where your parents will have _zero_ authority. Take that, Pops!

says.title: The Groupon Guide to: Rock 'n' Roll History
says.websiteContent:
Rock 'n' roll has a long and varied history. Here are some of its most important moments: 1902: Blues is invented by Blind Tommy Phlegmhat or Charlie “Knuckle Crumbs” Sickbody or something
1927: The first electric guitar is invented by Thomas Edison’s rebellious teenage nephew
1963: The Beatles first appear on _The Ed Sullivan Show_ to drink Coca-Cola and rev motorcycles
1972: Jimmy Page unveils his double-necked guitar where all the strings are also tiny guitars
1973–1996: Nothing
1997: Puff Daddy successfully fuses rap and rock 'n' roll with hit song “All About the Benjamins (Rock Remix) ft. Fuzz Bubble"
2000: Rock 'n' roll dies. No one cares.

says.emailContentHtml: What are the ways modern kids rebel against their parents? Find out in today's Groupon Guide.
says.title: The Groupon Guide to: Teenage Rebellion
says.websiteContent:
It's an important phase in every teenager's development to differentiate himself from his parents in the form of safe, experimental rebellion. Use this chart to gauge how to best rebel against your own parents' views and wishes: * **If your parents forbid you from hanging out with the cool kids:** Rub it in their faces when the absence of your positive influence leads them to drag race off all the cliffs in town.
* **If your parents listen to old-timey big-band jazz:** Listen to ear-splitting heavy-metal records.
* **If your parents listen to ear-splitting heavy-metal records:** Listen to talk radio that makes a mockery of their deeply held political beliefs.
* **If your parents ask you to wash the dog:** Do it without hesitation; don't make the dog a pawn in your childish game.
* **If your parents ground you for shoplifting candy:** Sneak out of the house and shoplift so much candy that you'll have to go to jail, where your parents will have _zero_ authority. Take that, Pops!

deals.highlightsHtml: On their first North American tour in three years, Nick, Joe, and Kevin thrill fans with hits and new sounds, such as single “Pom Poms”
deals.announcementTitle: Jonas Brothers Live Tour – $30 for Concert
deals.pitchHtml:
The Deal

  • $30 for one G-Pass to the Jonas Brothers Live Tour (up to a $40 value)
  • When: Tuesday, August 13, at 7 p.m.
  • Where: America's Cup Pavilion
  • Seating: bleachers, section 201–212
  • Door time: 6 p.m.
  • Ticket values include all fees.
  • Click here to view the seating chart.

Because the ticket is a G-Pass, Groupon customers can use it to enter the venue directly; they will not need to redeem their Groupon at will call. Due to security restrictions, G-Passes must be printed out and presented in person at the event. They cannot be redeemed through Groupon's mobile app.

Jonas Brothers

Three brothers taking a summer road trip across the country. It has the ring of a classic American narrative—or would, at least, if that ring weren’t drowned out by the arena-filling shrieks of excited concertgoers. For the Jonases, the journey certainly is “about reconnecting with our amazing fans, who have waited patiently for three years to hear new music from us”—as they said in announcing their upcoming tour—but to some extent, it’s also about reconnecting with each other. Since the release of their last album, 2009’s Lines, Vines, and Trying Times, the Grammy-nominated, multi-platinum-selling siblings have each taken slightly different trajectories as they’ve flown from the Disney nest. Joe launched his blues-rock solo project, Kevin starred on the reality TV show Married to Jonas, and Nick conquered Broadway as the star of How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying.

The theme song to this reunion is the explosive new single “Poms Poms.” Drenched in marching-band horns and a pyrotechnic backbeat, the song’s sizzle signals the trio’s maturation from teen-pop icons to man-pop icons while whetting fans’ whistles for their upcoming 2013 album. The new tour promises to crackle with the energy of a Pop Rocks–and-soda cocktail as the Brothers grace the stage with sure-footed choreography and fraternal harmonies in a set of past and future greatest hits.

says.emailContentHtml: What are some simple rhymes to help you moderate your drinking? Find out in today’s Groupon Guide.
says.title: The Groupon Guide to: Drinking Rhymes
says.websiteContent:
Everybody knows that rhymes such as “Liquor before beer, you’re in the clear; beer before liquor, never sicker” keep drinkers from getting sick. What are some of the most popular? * Brandy before rum, enjoy feeling numb. Rum before brandy, not feeling too dandy.
* Good beer before bad, what a delightful cad. Bad beer before good, you are the opposite of Robin Hood (a jerk).
* Shots before beer, to sickness the path is clear. Beer before shots, I’ve got the hots (for you).
* Beer before entire bottle of wine, you’re doing fine. Entire bottle of wine before beer, Groupon does not, under any circumstances, promote drinking to excess.

says.emailContentHtml: What unexpected treasures can you find at the dump? Find out in today's Groupon Guide.
says.title: The Groupon Guide to: One Man’s Trash
says.websiteContent:
So many people just throw out their “garbage” without stopping to think that it might be of value to someone else. Luckily, it all goes to the same place—the dump. Search around a little and you’ll find that this wonderful place is filled with all kinds of unexpected treasures: * Shredded tires
* Hats with the tops ripped off
* Dirty old baby dolls
* Dirty old fish bones
* Car seats with big bites taken out of them
* Shattered, discolored bathtubs
* Records, both musical and medical
* 2-liter bottles with different liquids inside them than what they started with
* Whoa, something hot!
* Boxes and boxes of broken glass

says.emailContentHtml: Do you remember the forgotten fifth Ninja Turtle?
says.title: The Groupon Guide to: Forgotten Team Members
says.websiteContent:
Pop culture is loaded with memorable teams, each member bringing his or her own distinct skills and personalities to the mission at hand. Massage your nostalgia gland and see if you can conjure up any memories of these forgotten pop-culture teammates: **Botticelli** (Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles): This sassy mutant reptile was rarely seen without his signature bow and arrow and pink mask.
**Best remembered for:** His catch phrase—"Now I've seen everything!"

**Duncan** (The Ghostbusters): This specter-zapping French-Canadian loves trapping ghosts almost as much as he loves his signature favorite meal—an ice cube on a piece of toast.
**Best remembered for:** Graphic death scene

**Hartford** (The Scooby-Doo Gang): This skeptical know-it-all doesn't believe in spooks and scaries—even when one is staring him right in his signature contact lenses.
**Best remembered for:** His catch phrase—"Maybe we shouldn't!"—and his graphic death scene

says.title: The Groupon Guide to: Drinking Rhymes
says.websiteContent:
Everybody knows that rhymes such as “Liquor before beer, you’re in the clear; beer before liquor, never sicker” keep drinkers from getting sick. What are some of the most popular? * Brandy before rum, enjoy feeling numb. Rum before brandy, not feeling too dandy.
* Good beer before bad, what a delightful cad. Bad beer before good, you are the opposite of Robin Hood (a jerk).
* Shots before beer, to sickness the path is clear. Beer before shots, I’ve got the hots (for you).
* Beer before entire bottle of wine, you’re doing fine. Entire bottle of wine before beer, Groupon does not, under any circumstances, promote drinking to excess.

says.websiteContent:
Whether because of a vacation or a move, we are often called upon to say goodbye. Here are some of the most effective ways: * “Tell my wife I told you to tell my wife that … goodbye.”
* “I always wanted to kiss you but only because I hated you.”
* “Arrivederci." (millionaires only)
* “Stench ya later.”
* “I’m truly better for being involved with all of you. Thank you, and I want only the best things for you. You are great. Here are a bunch of dogs spelling out ‘Goddbye’ (they tried their hardest).”

deals.highlightsHtml: Donations fund an eight-week dance class for children at a local school during which interns teach styles such as Latin, ballet, and hip hop
deals.announcementTitle: $10 Donation for Youth Dance Class
deals.pitchHtml:
The Issue: Benefits of Arts Education for Youth

Kids who are involved in the arts are more likely to be recognized for academic achievement, elected to class office, and participate in a math and science fair, according to a report from Americans for the Arts. However, despite these proven benefits, school arts budgets area being cut and the cost of arts programs outside school remain prohibitively expensive for many families. By attending free dance classes, youth who do not normally have access to the arts can practice etiquette and social behavior in partner dances, develop creative thinking skills as they master new steps, and increase their self-confidence by performing for their peers.

The Campaign: Providing Dance Class for School Kids

All donations to this Grassroots campaign will be used by Dance Daze in Schools to provide dance courses for students in local schools. For every $500 raised, Dance Daze in Schools can provide an eight-week dance course in a variety of dance styles such as hip-hop, ballet, and Latin dancing at one Title I School. Students in the class with learn original choreography, create their own movement phrases, and connect with dance as an art form. Any funds raised beyond the initial $500 will go toward establishing a permanent dance studio at that same school.

details.description: 100% of donations go directly to Dance Daze in Schools. Donations are automatically applied. See Grassroots FAQs that apply to this campaign.

says.title: The Groupon Guide to: One Man’s Trash
says.websiteContent:
So many people just throw out their “garbage” without stopping to think that it might be of value to someone else. Luckily, it all goes to the same place—the dump. Search around a little and you’ll find that this wonderful place is filled with all kinds of unexpected treasures: * Shredded tires
* Hats with the tops ripped off
* Dirty old baby dolls
* Dirty old fish bones
* Car seats with big bites taken out of them
* Shattered, discolored bathtubs
* Records, both musical and medical
* 2-liter bottles with different liquids inside them than what they started with
* Whoa, something hot!
* Boxes and boxes of broken glass

deals.title: One-Night Stay at Hotel Avante in Mountain View, CA, Valid for Thursday-Sunday Check-In
deals.highlightsHtml: Elegant hotel with complimentary full breakfast and a heated outdoor pool & spa; just minutes from Mountain View attractions and businesses
deals.announcementTitle: Up to 43% Off at Hotel Avante in Mountain View, CA
deals.pitchHtml:
Elegant Hotel Close to Tech Headquarters and the Bay

Some of the world’s biggest tech companies, including Google, Mozilla Foundation, and Intuit, are headquartered in Mountain View, California, a Silicon Valley city named for its lovely views of the Santa Cruz Mountains. Hotel Avante sits just outside the city’s quaint downtown, within easy driving distance of picturesque Shoreline Park and a number of Silicon Valley HQs. The nearby tech giants may have influenced the hotel—an Etch-a-Sketch and Rubik’s Cube in each room helped Hotel Avante earn a spot on Wired’s list of the nation’s geekiest hotels.

Hotel Avante’s luxurious guest rooms feature Egyptian cotton linens, 32-inch flat-screen TVs, and moveable furniture so you can achieve feng shui or build a killer fort. For a little more space, choose the upgraded Deluxe King rooms, which have rain showerheads and iPod docking stations. Each morning there’s a complimentary full breakfast. Afterwards, you can take a dip in the heated outdoor pool and hot tub.

Greater San Jose, California: Silicon Valley’s Largest City near Wine Country

Mountain View is located in between Palo Alto and San Jose, and its neighboring cities collectively host the headquarters of Silicon Valley’s most-prominent businesses, including Apple, Google, and Intel. The influx of money from the tech sector has attracted fine-dining restaurants, shops, and a thriving arts scene. Mountain View is home to the spectacular Shoreline Amphitheatre, which hosts outdoor shows year-round. In San Jose, you’ll find a renowned contemporary art collection at the San Jose Museum of Art, as well as venues for the symphony, opera, and ballet.

Microchips haven’t completely taken over the farmland around San Jose, though. The jagged Santa Cruz Mountains and rolling valleys have rich soils for growing grapes. Silicon Valley’s wine country—also known as the Santa Clara Valley—has more than 20 wineries that produce pinot noir, syrah, and zinfandel. There’s also a wide selection of golf courses that you can enjoy year-round thanks to the area’s Mediterranean-like weather.

Read the Fine Print for important info on travel dates and other restrictions.

deals.pitchHtml:
Top Reasons to Stay at the Long Barn Lodge

  • Located amid the Stanislaus National Forest in the Sierra Nevadas, the Long Barn Lodge offers plenty of recreational activities, from swimming in the outdoor pool to playing volleyball or horseshoes.
  • The lodge dates back to 1925, when rancher Warren Beal built the structure as a boarding house for travelers heading over the Sonora Pass.
  • Two-queen guest rooms are tucked into the lodge’s main building. Freestanding studio cabins provide ample space for families for four and are equipped with a full kitchen and cable TV.
  • You can venture into town to grab dinner, or borrow one of the lodge’s barbecues to grill your own meal.
  • Yosemite National Park is less than two hours’ drive away. There, you can hike amid waterfalls in spring and early summer, horseback ride down scenic trails, or walk past the cliffs at Yosemite Valley.

Long Barn, California: Fishing, Swimming, and Biking in the Sierra Nevadas

The small, rustic town of Long Barn, California is located within the Stanislaus National Forest in the Sierra Nevada mountain range. The area is rife with outdoor activity no matter the season, but it’s particularly vibrant during the summer months. At nearby Pinecrest Lake, you can fish, hike, swim, and boat during the day, and catch an after-dark flick at the Pinecrest Amphitheater. With hundreds of miles of dirt trails and four mountain passes, Long Barn is also a popular destination for both on- and off-road motorcycle riding.

There are also two recommended day trips within a two-hour drive of Long Barn. Two hours east is Bodie, one of California’s most famous ghost towns. Once a gold rush-era boomtown with more than 65 saloons, Bodie was deserted in the early 20th century. Today, it’s a State Historic Park that’s open to the public with 100 well-preserved structures.

Less than 90 miles south of Long Barn lies the entrance to Yosemite National Park, which welcomes millions of annual visitors. Spring is one of the best times to see the park’s famed waterfalls, thanks to the snowmelt brought on by warmer weather. Yosemite Falls—a three-tiered waterfall that’s considered North America’s highest—transforms into thundering cataracts each spring. Serious hikers can trek to the top on the strenuous Upper Yosemite Falls trail, which gains 2,700 feet in elevation in just 3.5 miles.

Read the Fine Print for important info on travel dates and other restrictions.

Everybody knows that rhymes such as “Liquor before beer, you’re in the clear; beer before liquor, never sicker” keep drinkers from getting sick. What are some of the most popular? * Brandy before rum, enjoy feeling numb. Rum before brandy, not feeling too dandy.
* Good beer before bad, what a delightful cad. Bad beer before good, you are the opposite of Robin Hood (a jerk).
* Shots before beer, to sickness the path is clear. Beer before shots, I’ve got the hots (for you).
* Beer before entire bottle of wine, you’re doing fine. Entire bottle of wine before beer, Groupon does not, under any circumstances, promote drinking to excess.

merchant.name: Adonis Tulum Riviera Maya Gay Resort & Spa

deals.highlightsHtml: An adults-only, gay-friendly resort with an infinity pool, four outdoor hot tubs, and several international restaurants
deals.announcementTitle: All-Inclusive Resort in Riviera Maya
deals.pitchHtml:
Posh, Adults-Only Resort on Riviera Maya

Though the Adonis Tulum Riviera Maya Gay Resort & Spa is primarily geared toward the LGBT community, the posh property bills itself as "straight-friendly." The only thing you, as a guest, have to be is 18 or older. Perched on a bluff overlooking the Caribbean Sea, the resort offers a range of distinctly grown-up indulgences, including four hot tubs, an onsite spa, and a discreet, clothing-optional area.

The decor is a blend of Mediterranean and traditional Mayan influences. Grecian columns and thatched roofs surround the hot tubs and a separate infinity pool, where water cascades down a stepped wall and seems to reach all the way to the ocean. All-inclusive privileges grant access to a slew of onsite restaurants. El Nopal serves upscale Mexican cuisine in a dining room adorned with vibrant folk tapestries, and Asian fare is prepared at Kamasutra, where a wall of windows overlooks the pool.

You can enjoy drinks after dark at one of the resort's swanky lounges. At Spirit Night Club, soft lavender lights illuminate mod barstools as servers sling inventive cocktails and DJs spin dance tunes into the wee hours. At the end of the day, retire to your luxurious Partenon suite to cool off with a rainfall shower or unwind in the in-room jacuzzi. The resort also has a spa where you can get pampered with an organic body treatment or a couples massage.

Riviera Maya: Rich with History and Tropical Calm

Just south of Playa del Carmen, the ancient Mayan seaport of Tulum overlooks the Caribbean from white beaches and rocky bluffs. The inhabitants of Tulum—which means "walled" in Mayan—first erected the city's outer fortress to protect themselves from belligerent tribes. Today, visitors can traipse from the beach to the city's ancient ruins, which include temples and a cliff-side castle.

A scenic drive brings you to the Yucatán Peninsula's legendary limestone cenotes, freshwater sinkholes created by an underground river system. At the Cenote Cristalino, intrepid visitors jump from terraced outcroppings into the exposed pool or go snorkeling in the underwater caves. At this popular weekend hangout, you can watch locals expertly flip, dive, and synchronized cannonball into the clear water.

Read the Fine Print for important info on travel dates and other restrictions.

says.title: The Groupon Guide to: Saying Goodbye
says.websiteContent:
Whether because of a vacation or a move, we are often called upon to say goodbye. Here are some of the most effective ways: * “Tell my wife I told you to tell my wife that … goodbye.”
* “I always wanted to kiss you but only because I hated you.”
* “Arrivederci." (millionaires only)
* “Stench ya later.”
* “I’m truly better for being involved with all of you. Thank you, and I want only the best things for you. You are great. Here are a bunch of dogs spelling out ‘Goddbye’ (they tried their hardest).”

deals.announcementTitle: Half Off Tasting Tour for Two at Alegio Chocolate
deals.pitchHtml:
A good chocolate is as indulgent as a house where the beds are all hot tubs and the couches are all beds. Treat yourself to this Groupon.

$15 for a Chocolate-Tasting Tour for Two ($30 Value)

During each 45-minute tour, guides describe the chocolate-making process on Claudio Corallo's plantation, which ships all-natural cocoa to Alegio from its small African island of São Tomé and Príncipe. In the manner of a traditional wine tasting, participants carefully savor 12 samples of handmade chocolates as the guide describes how Claudio derives his rich flavors from the botanical descendants of Africa's first cacao plants.

says.emailContentHtml: How can you tell if someone you love is a robot? Find out in today's Groupon Guide.
says.title: The Groupon Guide to: Robot Lingo
says.websiteContent:
Robots are all among us, blending in perfectly—unless you know to listen for the telltale robot lingo they use to secretly communicate with each other. Keep your natural, fleshy ears peeled for these robo-slang giveaways: * **Softies:** _Humans_
* **Franks:** _In reference to skinless hot dogs (slang for humans)_
* **LCMs:** _Lucky Charms marshmallows (slang for baby humans)_
* **Sparkin':** _Popular robot style of kissing_
* **Bolt Cutters:** _Traitorous robots that hunt down escaped robots for their human scientist masters_
* **Knife Hands:** _Not slang_
* **Biofuel:** _Every part of a human except for the bones_
* **Delicious Pizza Pies:** _Depending on the context, either pizza or humans_

says.emailContentHtml: What unexpected treasures can you find at the dump? Find out in today's Groupon Guide.
says.title: The Groupon Guide to: One Man’s Trash
says.websiteContent:
So many people just throw out their “garbage” without stopping to think that it might be of value to someone else. Luckily, it all goes to the same place—the dump. Search around a little and you’ll find that this wonderful place is filled with all kinds of unexpected treasures: * Shredded tires
* Hats with the tops ripped off
* Dirty old baby dolls
* Dirty old fish bones
* Car seats with big bites taken out of them
* Shattered, discolored bathtubs
* Records, both musical and medical
* 2-liter bottles with different liquids inside them than what they started with
* Whoa, something hot!
* Boxes and boxes of broken glass

says.emailContentHtml: What are some simple rhymes to help you moderate your drinking? Find out in today’s Groupon Guide.
says.title: The Groupon Guide to: Drinking Rhymes
says.websiteContent:
Everybody knows that rhymes such as “Liquor before beer, you’re in the clear; beer before liquor, never sicker” keep drinkers from getting sick. What are some of the most popular? * Brandy before rum, enjoy feeling numb. Rum before brandy, not feeling too dandy.
* Good beer before bad, what a delightful cad. Bad beer before good, you are the opposite of Robin Hood (a jerk).
* Shots before beer, to sickness the path is clear. Beer before shots, I’ve got the hots (for you).
* Beer before entire bottle of wine, you’re doing fine. Entire bottle of wine before beer, Groupon does not, under any circumstances, promote drinking to excess.

says.emailContentHtml: How can you tell if someone you love is a robot? Find out in today's Groupon Guide.
says.title: The Groupon Guide to: Robot Lingo
says.websiteContent:
Robots are all among us, blending in perfectly—unless you know to listen for the telltale robot lingo they use to secretly communicate with each other. Keep your natural, fleshy ears peeled for these robo-slang giveaways: * **Softies:** _Humans_
* **Franks:** _In reference to skinless hot dogs (slang for humans)_
* **LCMs:** _Lucky Charms marshmallows (slang for baby humans)_
* **Sparkin':** _Popular robot style of kissing_
* **Bolt Cutters:** _Traitorous robots that hunt down escaped robots for their human scientist masters_
* **Knife Hands:** _Not slang_
* **Biofuel:** _Every part of a human except for the bones_
* **Delicious Pizza Pies:** _Depending on the context, either pizza or humans_

says.emailContentHtml: What unexpected treasures can you find at the dump? Find out in today's Groupon Guide.
says.title: The Groupon Guide to: One Man’s Trash
says.websiteContent:
So many people just throw out their “garbage” without stopping to think that it might be of value to someone else. Luckily, it all goes to the same place—the dump. Search around a little and you’ll find that this wonderful place is filled with all kinds of unexpected treasures: * Shredded tires
* Hats with the tops ripped off
* Dirty old baby dolls
* Dirty old fish bones
* Car seats with big bites taken out of them
* Shattered, discolored bathtubs
* Records, both musical and medical
* 2-liter bottles with different liquids inside them than what they started with
* Whoa, something hot!
* Boxes and boxes of broken glass

deals.pitchHtml:

* “Stench ya later.”
* “I’m truly better for being involved with all of you. Thank you, and I want only the best things for you. You are great. Here are a bunch of dogs spelling out ‘Goddbye’ (they tried their hardest).”

deals.highlightsHtml: Elegant watches with white ceramic cases; some designs flaunt crystal accents or mother-of-pearl dials
deals.announcementTitle: Up to 93% Off Akribos XXIV Watches
deals.pitchHtml:
The Deal

  • Akribos XXIV ceramic watches for men and women starting at $49.99
  • Click here to view an image and detailed specification for each option.

Akribos XXIV

It seems only natural for a watchmaker to be concerned with history. The founders of Akribos XXIV were fascinated by the ancient history of timekeeping, which has roots in Greece and Rome. To commemorate the ancient art, they named their company for the two powers. In Greek, Akribos means “exact and precise;” XXIV are the Roman numerals for 24, as well as Prince’s latest signature. Taken together, the name both pays homage to the past and makes a promise for the future. Each timepiece the company crafts is meticulously designed to track all 24 hours in a day. Furthermore, every watch doubles as an eye-catching accessory. Details such as sunray dials, crystal-accented bezels, and braided bracelets represent the company’s distinctive style: bold, fashion-forward, and functional.

Features
  • Watches for men and women
  • Analog display
  • White ceramic cases
  • Some styles feature mother-of-pearl dials or crystal accents
  • Japanese or Swiss quartz movement
  • Water resistant like a coconut in a swim cap

How to get your goods: by purchasing this Groupon and providing your name and shipping address, your order is complete!

says.title: The Groupon Guide to: Saying Goodbye
says.websiteContent:
Whether because of a vacation or a move, we are often called upon to say goodbye. Here are some of the most effective ways: * “Tell my wife I told you to tell my wife that … goodbye.”
* “I always wanted to kiss you but only because I hated you.”
* “Arrivederci." (millionaires only)
* “Stench ya later.”
* “I’m truly better for being involved with all of you. Thank you, and I want only the best things for you. You are great. Here are a bunch of dogs spelling out ‘Goddbye’ (they tried their hardest).”

deals.title: $19.99 for a Vine Street Market, USA Tote ($60 List Price). 4 Styles Available. Free Shipping and Returns.
deals.highlightsHtml: Carryall totes made from repurposed fabric hold up to 60 pounds and add style to the outfits of Alicia Silverstone and Olivia Munn
deals.announcementTitle: $19.99 for a Vine Street Market, USA Tote
deals.pitchHtml:
The Deal

$19.99 for a Vine Street Market, USA eco-friendly fashion tote ($60 list price). Choose from the following styles:

  • Black-and-white striped denim
  • Black leopard
  • I Love Hearts (black and red)
  • Tossed Hearts (hot pink)

Click here to view an image of each option.

Vine Street Market, USA Eco-Friendly Fashion Totes

Called “the perfect casual everything bag,” by Alicia Silverstone, these bags are part ofVine Street Market, USA's mission to elevate eco-friendly garb to fashionable accessories. These eye-catching bags are made with repurposed fabrics, organic materials, and eco-friendly manufacturing methods, and they add style to trips to the beach or grocery store with heart, leopard-print, and stripe motifs. The durable totes are as functional as they are fashionable, holding up to 60 pounds without ripping a seam or complaining loudly about taking your pet-rock collection for a walk. After use, wearers can fold the bag up and tuck it neatly into its own pocket for convenient storage.

Features
  • Fashionable carryall tote
  • Durable canvas construction
  • Made from repurposed fabrics and organic materials
  • Holds up to 60 pounds
  • Folds up into its own pocket, like a kangaroo playing hide-and-seek
  • Weight: 0.5 lbs.
  • Dimensions: 34” (L) x 22” (W)
  • See here for basic care instructions.

How to get your goods: by purchasing this Groupon and providing your name and shipping address, your order is complete!

For questions pertaining to this deal, please visit the deal Q&A on this page. For post-purchase inquiries, please contact Groupon customer service.

deals.title: $24.99 for Two Fruit-Infuser Glass Water Bottles ($60 List Price). Four Colors Available. Free Shipping and Returns.
deals.highlightsHtml: Two-pack of BPA-free glass bottles with infusers for steeping fresh fruit, vegetables, and herbs to add flavor to water
deals.announcementTitle: $24.99 for Two Fruit-Infuser Water Bottles
deals.pitchHtml:
The Deal

  • $24.99 for a two-pack of Flavour It fruit-infuser glass water bottles ($60 list price)
  • Available in blue, green, red, or yellow

Flavour It Glass Fruit-Infuser Water-Bottle Two-Pack

Each Flavour It water bottle houses a removable infusing chamber which lightly flavors liquids with your favorite fresh fruit, vegetables, herbs, and condiments. The BPA-free glass bottles are outfitted with colorful silicone rings to give the infuser a snug, secure fit. The bottles are also dishwasher safe for convenient cleaning between uses.

Features
  • Removable fruit infuser holds fresh fruits, vegetables, and herbs to lightly flavor water
  • Silicone ring gives the infuser a fit as snug as a lounge singer's pants
  • Stain-resistant materials
  • BPA-free
  • Dishwasher safe for easy cleaning
  • Bottle capacity: 20-ounces
  • Four colors available
  • Dimensions: 3"x6.13"x8.75"
  • Total weight: 2 pounds, 5 ounces

How to get your goods: by purchasing this Groupon and providing your name and shipping address, your order is complete!

deals.title: $39.99 for a 1.7-Ounce Jar of Kinerase Pro+Therapy Ultra Rich Day Repair Cream ($149 List Price). Free Shipping.
deals.highlightsHtml: Hydrating day cream packed with nourishing ingredients that help improve the appearance of wrinkles, texture, and tone
deals.announcementTitle: $39.99 for Kinerase Pro+Therapy Ultra Rich Day Repair Cream
deals.pitchHtml:
The Deal

$39.99 for a 1.7 ounce jar of Kinerase Pro+Therapy Ultra Rich Day Repair ($149 list price)

Kinerase Pro+Therapy Ultra Rich Day Repair Cream

Wrinkles, uneven tone, and some loss of elasticity are all hallmarks of normally aging skin. Kinerase’s luxurious day cream infuses the skin with moisture that helps those signs of maturity ebb away. The cream contains an anti-aging proprietary blend including photosomes to fight sun damage, pentavitin to encourage moisture retention, and pephactive to help boost overall skin radiance. The rich formula can be applied in the morning via a dollop on a finger or the filling of an expertly launched pie.

Features
  • Hydrating day cream by Kinerase
  • Helps improve appearance of wrinkles, texture, and tone
  • Ideal for dry, mature, post-procedural or environmentally damaged skin
  • Formula with photosomes, pentavitin, kinetin, zeatin, and pephactive
  • Non-comedogenic, hypoallergenic
  • 1.7 ounce jar
  • Click here to view a list of ingredients
